strategyDetails:
Nihilego's typing allows it to switch into a majority of the tier's Defoggers, including Salamence, Mandibuzz, and Moltres, and set Stealth Rock. Power Gem threatens many Defoggers and hits neutral targets Sludge Bomb can't, like Galarian Slowbro, Skarmory, and Celesteela. Sludge Bomb threatens Pokemon such as Tangrowth and Primarina. Knock Off cripples checks to Nihilego like Aegislash, Chansey, and Celesteela. It's also great for removing Heavy-Duty Boots from Defoggers. Grass Knot eliminates Pokemon that don't mind Power Gem + Sludge Bomb, like Swampert. However, the utility Knock Off provides is amazing, and it's only worth replacing if Nihilego's team has enough other Knock Off users. Black Sludge mitigates entry hazards and chip damage.

This set fits on every playstyle except hyper offense. Nihilego's team appreciates its good defensive typing and Knock Off, and its offensive capabilities are valuable for removing threats like Primarina and Salamence. Stall in particular appreciates Nihilego's good matchup against Nasty Plot Togekiss. Skarmory is an amazing partner for Nihilego, forming an entry hazard stacking core with it and checking major threats like Excadrill and Krookodile. In return, Nihilego beats threats to Skarmory like Moltres and Thundurus-T. Wallbreakers like Thundurus-T, Mienshao, and Conkeldurr love Nihilego setting up Stealth Rock and weakening their checks like Assault Vest Tangrowth, Celesteela, and Amoonguss. Chansey completely walls this set even after having its Eviolite removed, so these wallbreakers can also take care of it. Pivots like the aformentioned Mienshao and Zarude can bring in Nihilego to set Stealth Rock and wallbreak. Teammates like Azelf, Krookodile, and Tangrowth provide Knock Off support, giving Nihilego the option of running Grass Knot. Aegislash has notable defensive synergy with Nihilego, as it checks Pokemon like Galarian Slowbro, Lycanroc-D, and Slowking. Moltres and Rotom-H deal with Steel-types that wall Nihilego, like Aegislash and Jirachi. Nihilego in return can take out physically defensive Tangrowth and Salamence.

pokemonAbilities.abilityDetails: This Pokemon's highest stat is raised by 1 if it attacks and KOes another Pokemon.

strategyItems.itemDetails: Each turn, if holder is a Poison type, restores 1/16 max HP; loses 1/8 if not.

strategyFirstMoves.moveDetails: Hurts foes on switch-in. Factors Rock weakness.

strategyFourthMoves.moveDetails: 1.5x damage if foe holds an item. Removes item.
